bio: Calypso Rose is an entrepreneur and started the first UK Delivers in the small, seaside town of Deal. Previously ITV’s Young Business Person of the Year, and founder of experience gift company ‘The Indytute’. The Indytute mantra is ‘Give Good Times’ — real-life experiences over ‘stuff’.
name: Deal Delivers
description: Deal Delivers has gone from strength to strength with over 110 local business listings and with 17% of the towns residents using the Deal Delivers Facebook page. The community is determined to shop locally for everything from Sourdough to Stick Insects!

name: Dulwich Delivers
description: With over 140 listings, Dulwich Delivers helps connect those at home with local businesses in South East London, whether in Dulwich, Peckham, Brockley, Brixton, or beyond. As well as bread, milk, coffee, and veg boxes, you can now order kimchi, sourdough starter, Peckham-made hand sanitiser, or cans of mead.

name: Reigate Delivers
description: Nestled under the North Downs, Reigate's high street boasts many independent shops and businesses. With well over 60 listings Reigate Delivers has helped those businesses reach an even larger audience as they adapt to delivery and collection.

bio: As a first time mum during lockdown, community and networking have become a lifeline for Nina, it has enabled her to discover local gems and meet new friends. Using her background in social media and marketing, her mission is to keep her local community connected using the power of The Delivers platform.
name: Four Heatons Deliver
description: Nestled in between Manchester and Stockport, The Heatons is full of independent businesses and a close-knit community. Our goal at Four Heatons Deliver is to ensure local people discover the variety of businesses on their doorsteps (or contact free collection).

bio: Clair Breen was born and grew up in Ashford and her family remain in the town.  She now lives in the nearby village of Mersham.  She is a TV Producer by trade, but whilst productions are on hold, she wanted to make good use of her time in isolation to do something good for her local community.
name: Ashford Delivers
description: Right in the heart of Kent, the famous "Garden of England", Ashford has bloomed into a lively, cosmopolitan commercial centre. Officially a market town, Ashford's fortunes took a swift upward turn with the opening of Ashford International railway station in 1996. However, despite all this activity, Ashford retains its rural charm and is surrounded by beautiful villages. You'll find 19th Century windmills and medieval buildings alongside bright shopping centres and trendy restaurants. You're only ever a stroll away from the scent of apple orchards, the sight of rolling hills and the tranquil sound of wild birds singing.
